titles.title: Corinth, Mississippi, Battlefield Act of 1993
Corinth, Mississippi, Battlefield Act of 1994
Corinth, Mississippi, Battlefield Act of 1993
A bill to provide for an interpretive center at the Civil War Battlefield of Corinth, Mississippi, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6133)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Department of the Interior, and Office of Management and Budget.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 103-516.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston with amendments. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 289.

vote.text: Passed Senate with amendments by Voice Vote.

action.text: Received in the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
By Senator Johnston from Committee on Energy and Natural Resources filed written report under the authority of the order of Nov 17, 93. Report No. 103-211.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.
Executive Comment Requested from Interior.

committee.name: House Committee on Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests and Public Lands

action.text: Subcommittee Hearings Held.
Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 103-813.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 458.

action.text: Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed until Oct. 4.
Considered as unfinished business.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays (2/3 required): 363 - 45 (Roll No. 487).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and at the desk: House amendment to Senate bill.

committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

committee.name: House Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands

bill.summary: 10/5/1994--Passed House amended. TABLE OF CONTENTS: Title I: Civil War Battlefield of Corinth, Mississippi Title II: Stones River National Battlefield Title I: Civil War Battlefield of Corinth, Mississippi - Corinth, Mississippi, Battlefield Act of 1994 - Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to provide for an interpretive center in the vicinity of the Corinth Battlefield in Mississippi for the purpose of interpreting the 1862 Civil War Siege and Battle of Corinth. Requires the Secretary, within 18 months after the enactment of this Act, to complete a plan and design for the center and to submit it to specified congressional committees. Authorizes the Secretary, with the owner's consent, to acquire lands and interests in lands by donation, purchase, or exchange to implement the plan or design. Requires the Secretary to enter into a binding agreement with a qualified non-Federal entity for conveyance by deed or lease from the Secretary of any structure or property acquired and developed under this Act. Authorizes appropriations. Title II: Stones River National Battlefield - Expands the boundaries of the Stones River National Battlefield in Tennessee.
